data.title: Using Cmd+Scroll to zoom on a mac
data.body:
Issue Microsoft/monaco-editor#201

Bug
Cmd + Scroll doesn't work on a mac. Only Ctrl+Scroll. 
Most mac users would be used to using Cmd instead of Ctrl. 

Fix
Zoom on both Ctrl+Scroll and Cmd+Scroll (metaKey). 

closes Microsoft/monaco-editor#201

data.title: How to ship an opt-in extension update?
data.body:
We want to ship opt-in bug fix updates to our extension without annoying users by pushing too frequent updates. How can we do this? I'm not sure yet if it already behaves this way. We don't want the update info message box to appear. We want the updated version to appear in the @outdated list and for people who don't already have the extension installed.

If some property could be added to the packages.json or some option in the publishing tool that would be great.

data.title: Open recent file option
data.body:
I would like to see an "Open recent file" (within folder/project). 
I got used to use the Git tab for this, but just until commit, after commit, I'm sold.

After commit and close all opened files, if I need to make a quick fix, I got remember the files I was messing with. If we had an "Open recent file" or "Recent Activity" that would be very handy.

data.title: Show Markdown Preview Menu Button For any File Opened as Markdown
data.body:
Issue #7638

**Bug**
Open a `.txt` file containing markdown in VSCode. Select the editor language as `markdown` and the highlighing kicks in, but there is no preview button for the file.

**Fix**
Base display of the markdown preview button on `resourceScheme` instead of `resourceLangId`.

![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12821956/18760051/30daecc2-80b4-11e6-9b62-aa24ad5fb67e.gif)

Closes #7638

data.title: Ability to add custom context menu extension to documents opened using OpentTextDocument
data.body:
I am looking to add a custom context menu item to a json document I create using OpenTextDocument. It seems that the context are only available for editor files and the explorer window. 
Thanks.

data.title: how did it get so bloated?
data.body: leave it to microsoft to have it install helpers and all kinds of other junk. thanks, off to atom i go.

data.title: Fix markdown  colorization of links inside of lists and quotes
data.body: Issue #12344 **Bug** Currently, markdown colorization is different for inlines of inside lists and quotes. For example, links inside lists or block quotes end up getting colored differently than normal links. **Fix** - Add a scope to the textmate markdown grammar so that we can identify the symbol that starts a list or quote. - Remove foreground rule for lists and quotes since this just duplicates the normal text color. The generated CSS selector is more specific than the one for link descriptions, so the list foreground color overrides it. - Only apply special puctuator colorization to the start symbol for lists and quotes. This only currently updates the dark and light themes. I'll investigate update the others as well. Closes #12344

data.title: Debugger gets detached
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra

Steps to Reproduce:

1) Create break points in Node.js
2) Run/debug app and make sure breakpoints are triggered
3) Stop app
4) run again and try triggering breakpoints again

Expected: App stops on breakpoints
Actual: App stops / debugger detached.

data.title: Show Popular Extensions shortcut Ctrl+J does nothing
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.5.3 (does not display Ctrl+J shortcut hint on 1.5.2)
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Extension View
2. Ctrl+J                   nothing happens
3. Show Recommended Extensions
4. Try Ctrl+J again    nothing happens

Status bar shows "(Ctrl+J) was pressed. Waiting for second key of chord..."

According to Default Keyboard Shortcuts Ctrl+J is bound to togglePanel.

{ "key": "ctrl+j",                "command": "workbench.action.togglePanel" }

This appears to be a new shortcut displayed in 1.5.3.  There is no shortcut for Show Popular Extensions on 1.5.2. Could this have been brought in when the translation resources were added?

data.title: Ctrl + left click(Mouse) is not working.
Allow to specify the tsconfig.json filename explicitly

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
currently VSCode uses the file with the exact name `tsconfig.json` in the folder as the project file for a typescript project, 

i have a few other project files named differently for corresponding sub-projects **inside the same folder**, I wish there was a way to tell VSCode to use one of them rather then the default `tsconfig.json`

data.title: Feature request: tab to cycle through auto-complete options (like sublime text)
data.body: Currently VSCode's autocomplete just selects the first option if you press Tab or Enter.  In order to select a different option you have to use the arrow keys.  Tab is a much easier key to hit, and it's already redundant since Enter does the same thing in this context... I suggest changing it (or giving the option to) so it cycles through autocomplete options a-la Sublime Text style.

data.title: launch.json generation
data.body:
- [x] any os @egamma 

Complexity: 2

We have changed the way how we get the content for the initial 'launch.json'. More details #9061. 
Have a workspace with no 'launch.json' file and verify:
- A proper 'launch.json' gets generated for the following debug types: node, extension host, go...
- For node debugging the content of the 'package.json' is read and the generated 'program' attribute in 'launch.json' points to the one referenced there (example: use [vscode-smoketest-express](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express) workspace)

data.title: Support extension metadata localization
data.body:
Currently this is supported for English only for all extension metadata except contributions.
- [ ] Publish `package.json` localisations as assets from the Marketplace (vsce)
- [ ] Localize metadata based on user's locale in 
  - [ ] Extension viewlet
  - [ ] Extension editor

- [x] explore how to leverage the new typings story for JavaScript
- [x] explore automated acquisition of typings

data.title: VSCode hangs on invalid keybindings.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open keyboard shortcuts
2. clear it out
3. paste in  
   
   ``` json
   { "key": "cmd+d",           "command": "editor.action.addSelectionToNextFindMatch",
                                    "when": "editorFocus" },
   ```
4. receive error about not bing an array. Try to use arrow keys and backspace to fix but they don't work. 
5. save and restart.
6. enjoy brick

referenced [issue](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/9566#issuecomment-248884528)

data.title: Git integration not working when VSCode from binary
data.body:
## Informations
- VSCode Version: 1.5.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12

I use SourceTree to have all my repositories listed, and a feature for opening a repo directly into VScode (see steps below).
But when I open it this way, the Git panel tells me that Git isnt installed on the system. However, if I just open VSCode normally by clicking on the icon and drop the repository folder in it, it works perfectly fine.
I think its since the last update of VSCode, but Im not sure. It seemed to be ok before. SourceTree hasnt been updated recently, but VSCode did.
## Steps to Reproduce
1. You must use SourceTree, and set a custom command :
   ![](http://files.italic.fr/Monosnap_2016-09-22_16-32-05.jpg)
2. Then, open a repository with the custom command
   ![](https://files.not.live/Capture_decran_2016-09-22_a_16.39.49.jpg)
3. Go in the Git tab and let the sadness flow in your mind.  
   ![](http://files.italic.fr/BlogPost.vue_-_emmanuelbeziat_2016-09-22_16-41-16.jpg)

I have no way to see if the problem come with another app than SourceTree, but again I think its coming from the last update of VScode.

Thanks!

data.title: Add sorting to Open Editors list
data.body: This could be simply optional alphabetic sorting. As it stands when you have lots of files open it can be hard to match up files that are associated (e.g. circus.component.js and circus.component.html) without the tedious task of manually dragging them into order.

data.title: Format on Save
data.body: Given the infrastructure we have built for #239 we can offer something like `files.formatOnSave` whichs mean format a document whenever we are about to save it.

data.title: Issues with not case/fragment-normalizing file paths (macOS, Windows)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
In VS Code we deal with resource `URIs` across all layers. In most cases we use `URI.toString()` to decide if a resource is equal to another resource. This assumption is not very good when we talk about file system paths because on macOS and Windows a file path should be considered equal if the paths are identical, even if the casing differs (`/some/path` === `/SOME/path`). Only Linux has a case-sensitive file system where this rule does not apply.

This leads to numerous related issues:
- [x] Mac: chokidar file watcher does not work if you run with wrong casing (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1426)
- [ ] quick open and editors can show the same file multiple times (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17967, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/15120, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18718, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6152, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16824, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/18684, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19014, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19398)
